definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Not through the mousehole this time, he told himself.
sentences.chinese: 安德對自己說，這次不去老鼠洞。

sentences.english: Fill up the rat's hole right away.
Checking whether mice hole here, on cat' duty.
sentences.chinese: 檢查是否有老鼠洞，儘儘貓責。

sentences.english: If he could have got away from it by creeping into a rat's hole, he would have done so.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以鑽進老鼠洞來逃避的話，他會那麼做的。

sentences.english: Father stopped up the rat's holes.
sentences.chinese: 父親堵塞了那些老鼠洞。

sentences.english: The flooding began flushing out rat holes around the lake, triggering a literal rat race for higher ground.
sentences.chinese: 洪水沖垮了湖邊的老鼠洞，大批老鼠逃到高處避水。

sentences.english: A black cat was sitting outside a mouse hole for a few days.
sentences.chinese: 一隻黑貓在一個老鼠洞外坐了好幾天。

sentences.english: The book-case and bird-cage refused to go into the mousehole .
sentences.chinese: 書架和鳥籠就是不肯進老鼠洞。

sentences.english: First they went down through the mousehole, right through the hole in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 一開始他們鑽下地板，向右轉，進了老鼠洞。

definition: to punch a hole/to drill a hole/to dig a hole/to burrow
Dongkou county in Shaoyang 邵陽|邵阳[Shao4 yang2], Hunan
to dig into/to cut a mine into
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
